title: Ticket #7288: Prefer Blowfish over Triple DES
description: On a busy submit machine, many encrypted file transfers may consume significant CPU time. The default encryption method, Triple DES, has been deprecated for a few years now. Blowfish gives comparable protection while consuming much less CPU. Both are susceptible to birthday attacks due to their 64-bit block size. Blowfish is not recommended to encrypt files over 4GiB. This is the best we can do until we can use AES.
remarks:
2019-Oct-01 17:03:00 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good. I was concerned that this could potentially break compatibility for non-negotiated sessions between old and new versions of HTCondor. That's not a concern. The method is chosen by the execute side and propagated through the ClaimID to the submit side, so they always agree.

Side note: Why not delete all the test configs and have them just use the default?
